reviews.text:

Clean rooms 
Very good staff and service 
Buffet is great
Wonderful place for relaxation 
Pool is clean with warm water
Nice area, a lot of flowers here

reviews.text:
I am been here with my family.We are here first time.This hotel recommend for us our family and we are very happy that we relaxed in baron palace.All people very frandly and kind.We were in the family swimming pool and water there is warm.Also room always cleen.
Every day we are did with animation team funny games.My favorites is stretching because this is energy for all day.They are gave for us every day information about show
We are been on the beach and there a lot of fish.
Thanks for everything we are come back!!!
reviews.title: Favorite hotel!!!

reviews.text:
Ous stay here was very exceptional. This hotel has all the luxury you can imagine.
The restaurants are great and at the poolside the realy spoil you. Serving drinks at any moment, clean your sun glasses and spray rose water when the temprature is getting to high. In the evening you can have your apperative on the balcony in front of the lobby. With nice vieuws over the garden, pool and sea.

name: New Concord Hotel
rankingString: #8 of 9 Specialty lodging in Port Said

reviews.text:
It was terrible place, the room was dirty, the bathroom had broken peices, the air conditioner was broken and making a loud noise !!! Staff were OK
Prices were in average to that service. It's not a good place to stay at
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text:
Stayed there for one night for my friends wedding.. The room was basic, fairly clean. Bathroom was OK.
AC was poorly conditioning the room, and we were on July! I sadly had to leave it while i was out of it to come back to a proper temp.
And at night, i switched both the AC & the Fan on.

Breakfast was basic as well, a plate of fava beans, local bread, jam & cooked cheese, and a cup of tea :) 

Staff at the cafeteria are nice and helpful, they even brought me the breakfast up in my room :) 

The lady at the reception wasn't as friendly, but she was polite & professional. Yet, there was a gentleman at the reception in the evening when i came back from the wedding's reception, he was very cooperative and decent.

Location is okay. away from the Canal and downtown hubs, but still Cafes & shops are every where, just a walking distance.

To my surprise, Taxi cabs are quite cheap in Port Said! i haven't paid this so little amounts of money to a cab since the 80s; LITERALLY! 

To sum it up, New Concord is a fair stay altogether if you're not looking for anything fancy; it's quite functional and has all you need.
reviews.title: Basic & Okay

reviews.text:
This is a wonderful hotel, with a good resturant and children play area. The location is also awesome, as the beach can be viewed from the rooms balcony. If you want to go to the beach just ask them to open the rear door at vola in just 5 seconds your feet will be touching the sand of the beach

it was a family visit to port said for 3 days the weather was very nice and the place have the location and all the needed things to have a perfect family vacation.
so i was very happy with this place
reviews.title: family visit

reviews.text:
Huge hotel complex....must have been nice when it was new.  I am not certain but by the number of children and full families this place must rent out a goid portion of their rooms to full time Tennants. Kids were playing and yelling until nearly midnight.  We were awaken several times around 3 AM by people outside talking/yelling loudly. And there was a couple next to us that carried on loudly until 5 AM! I wasn't sure whether to be angry or envious!

Restaurant staff was very pleasant and professional. Food was good. 

Wireless Internet doesn't work. This was a problem as we needed Internet for work.

Refurbish the property, get roaming security to quite the place down after 10 PM, fix the internet......and you might have a hotel worth staying at. But unfortunately until that time, avoid the Noras Beach Hotel.
reviews.title: Tired hotel with some units rented to full time Tennants

Would definitely stay here again
reviews.title: Very Nice place

reviews.text:
The hotel location is excellent almost close to most of attractions, it covers parking as well.
Staff are helpful, suite was good and clean. I didn't like getting last floor suite without elevator, that was hard especially for old people.

Breakfast was good but can be better.
reviews.title: Excellent location and helpful staff

location.address: Tarh El Bahr Street, Next to Port Said Stadium and In Front of the Restaurants Complex, Port Said 99999 Egypt

reviews.text:
This was without a doubt one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. 

There was no wifi available at all, the T.V. didn't work, and the bathrooms were absolutely filthy. Moreover, the pillows and beds were extremely uncomfortable. 

Worst of all, however, was the fact that I got insect bites as soon as I lay down on the beds. At around 45$ a night for foreigners (which has to be paid in foreign currency - foreign currency which I didn't have!), this hotel is incredibly overpriced. I would highly recommend against staying here.
reviews.title: Terrible - Dirty and Overpriced

reviews.text:
Our room for 2 adults and 1 child was priced at Â£18 and our friends room (single man In twin bedroom) Â£14...it was very comfortable the bedroom clean with tv and balcony which was also safe and clean..the shower, sink and toilet were all clean but basic... Shower rail corroded around the top and shower curtain  very dated but much much better than any similarly priced places...the staff were extremely friendly and the small restaurant quaint and welcoming, yes there's no lift but its a small family run guest house with only about 5 floors and breakfast time was a joy...young man happy to run out to get our  child bottled water...breakfast was soft bread rolls and Arabic bread with various quality jams, English butter and cheese triangles then omlettes all round all served with juice, tea and coffee...while saxophonist Kenny g was played gently in the background..
Things have obviously changed here there was no night club  noise, no cigarette ends and no dirt! ...if in doubt look round first...that costs nothing...
reviews.title: Much better than any other of the cheaper hotels in port said....

reviews.text:
Since this hotel was written about in Lonely Planet 2006, it has been seriously neglected, is a major health risk, I very strongly advise no-one to stay here. The list of things wrong with this hotel is endless: dark, dingy, dirty, unhelpful, noisey, nothing works in the room, sullen staff, non-existent elevators, no towels, toilet rolls (or holders!), no drainage, filthy walls, no air-conditioning, and the final straw - a razor blade in the toilet!
I'm sorry to say we stayed in it one night, not that we slept with the noise from a nightclub across the road, numerous taxi and bus horns and general racket, guests arriving at 2.00am and re-arranging the room next to ours, with a screaming baby.... After repeated requests for breakfast in the dining room the next morning, which was unlit, there was no chef as he had 'gone out', we checked the kitchen - retched at the filth, dirty dishes, blocked sink, numerous piles of cigarette butts and ash, greasy walls & floor, etc - paid for our night and got the hell out as quick as we could.
We ended up paying for a rather expensive night at a Sonesta after that, but there is the Holiday or the New Concorde which looked far better prospects in the mid-range hotels, and plenty of people eating at the cafes on the ground floor - always a good sign.!
reviews.title: ATROCIOUS NEW REGENT

Obviously we are all talking to ourselves here.... as no managment response has been posted here at allğŸ¤”

Paid 2000 EGP for a night as i didnâ€™t have any other option in the City that lacks of hotel rooms. Staff are not friendly at all , breakfast is very poor. 

Overall the hotel in a very bad condition with no one who cares.

Just thought of updating people who tends to sleep there.
reviews.title: Bad....... Just bad

reviews.text: Warm welcome , clean and new room , sea view , large Tv, new and clean bathroom , bed very comfortable , worker very helpful , mr motaz hotel manager welcome us at check inn , good breakfast .. the only bad thing is too noisy at evening and night high music on beach till 12 Pm  ..donâ€™t know why we like to sleep at 10 pm so we are very up set of that .. very good all over except annoying Dj and bad music
reviews.title: New and good hotel

reviews.text:
When I was first told about my new assignment In Port Said, one of the first things I checked out online, was the hotel where I was told I would be staying. I was extremely delighted to find it was rated: 5 Stars with plenty of Amenities, such as:
â€¢	Pool
â€¢	Fitness Center / Gym
â€¢	Hot Tub
â€¢	Paid Wi-Fi
â€¢	Tennis Court
â€¢	Squash Courts
â€¢	Bowling 

When I arrived and saw where I would be staying, I was in total shock. From the moment I stepped inside the front door, I noticed the surroundings were completely dated, as in 20-30 years old Decor. The Hotel Foyer was extremely dirty and the smell of dust was overwhelming. When I inquired about the above mentioned Amenities, I was told, all was under Maintenance and all would open within weeks. The Concierge then showed me to my roomâ€¦â€¦â€¦OMGâ€¦â€¦ is an understatement!!! The rooms smelled of Dampness / Dust. The Carpets were walking with the dirt, and in General the conditions were very bad. 

The Insulation Properties of the Windows is non-existent. As when it is windy, the noise or whistles that project thru in to the room, make for Sleepless nights. Not even going to mention when it rainsâ€¦â€¦. Every Thursday / Friday nights, Weddings take place in the Hotel, which in general is nice to see and to experience a different culture celebrate in their own way. But if youâ€™re staying in a room at the front of the hotel, youâ€™re are definitely in for a culture shock, due the lack of Sound proofing in the windows. The noise of singing, cars blowing their horns, boy racers on the main road outside, again is overwhelming. 

Over the course of my Stay in Port Said Hotel, both myself and a lot of my Colleagues noticed money & Duty Free items go missing form our â€˜cozyâ€™ little rooms. Our complaints to Hotel Management fell on deaf ears. Now I donâ€™t want to Tar all the staff working there with the same brush, as there are Genuine Hard working people there, but I have also experienced the dark side â€¦â€¦ Some of The Men working in the Lobby Bar are driven only by money. I also experienced additional items being put on my hotel account even after signing the dockets. 
The Service in the Hotel is Generally Very Bad, with Customer Service / Customer Comfort at the bottom of the list, and the Locals who are working there, have very Basic English. The food often comes cold, and in 4/10 cases, is the wrong order. As like a lot of people, I enjoy a few cold beers after work, and when I arrived there, early 2017, the price of a â€˜canâ€™ not even draft was EGP 55. When I left, the price was at EGP 90. This is only one aspect, an
d just shows the mentality of the Manager and his pure greed, driven by money.
All of the above is from my actual experience staying in the hotel for a period of 2Â½ years, and of course my own opinion. I can relate to all the Bad reviews posted about The Port Said Hotel, but in fairness those that posted good reviews about this kip, need their heads examined.

By the way, The Amenities that were under maintenance when I originally arrived, are still is the same stateâ€¦NON EXISTENT â€¦â€¦â€¦..  5 STARSâ€¦I DONT THINK SO...........
reviews.title: A TripAdvisor Member 2 1/2 Years Experience .....By JAK.

reviews.text:
Stayed here for 6 days, it felt longer. Without putting in a review thats a mile long I will just summarize, all factual as you are aware my reviews are honest and genuine. 

Food, bland and always cold. At times, not everything you asked for is on the order
Atmosphere, none.
Some staff, helpful, not all
WIFI, poorest I have come across
Rooms, dull and although the cleaners do their best, need a really good scrub

Spoke to reception on a couple of issues and sent email, nothing back, no interest in customer service

This could be a fantastic hotel as it's quite a grand one inside but alas, it isn't
reviews.title: Lacks the basics

reviews.text:
VERY NICE PLACE where you can stay during your job/trip in Port Said ! 
Near of the beach, with wonderful sunset - I red  bad discussions on this hotel, but after my trip I cannot confirm - This hotel is very nice with very clean room - big and with big bathroom- everybody inside is very nice from waiters to man at the reception desk-
good breakfast- I saw  a Very special marriage in the garden an amazing experience.
Only no so good wifi ...
reviews.title: A NEW SITUATION

reviews.text:
Good location at the farthest Northern-east of Africa .. good for business too where you are near to most working companies and bank branches 

Service are not bad, they take care of client requests within the available possibilities 

They havenâ€™t a lot of option at the breakfast/launch but it is still has the variety that suite vegans and meat eaters 

Pool is too narrow and city view rooms are overlooking old buildings, mini markets and shops
reviews.title: Not too good and not bad

reviews.text:
Hotel is old fashioned which I can deal with..... but the hotel attitude is discussing! Not one person in the hotel wants to please the guest staying here! 
Requested to have some gym weights outside, due to the gym being closed for â€˜renovationâ€™. Would they let me? No! Even requested to speak to management but still no luck! I was there 4 weeks and nothing changed at the gym, so clearly not under maintenance!
Paying the bill..... hotel tried to rip me off, always trying to penny pinch! 

Would recommend choosing a different hotel, most hotels try to please the guests but certainly not this one!!!!

reviews.text:
I've stayed in most hotels in Port Said over the past 3 years, this is easily the best looking property. 2 swimming pools, close to the beach and supermarket, free (fairly fast for Port Said) internet The bathroom and kitchen facilities are only just adequate.

reviews.title: Guest Amenities

reviews.text:
We arrived the hotel around 11:30 am, Booked by telephone same day. 
they have a policy pre-booking and deposit. but as we were on our way we didn't transfer any deposits. 

stuff are friendly and helpful. 
our booking was bed and breakfast 

we were looking for a Hotel only for sleeping, so it was all what we needed. 
the rooms are good. but not all the rooms have AC or Fans. 

Pros: 
- Friendly Stuff
- nice breakfast 
- clean 
- affordable 

Cons: 
- No Elevators 
- small rooms 
- not all the rooms have ACs or Fans (I am not sure what do they do during summer season) 

Over all it was a nice night experience.
reviews.title: Good One Night experience

name: Panorama Portsaid Hotel
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.

reviews.text: Its a good location , you can see the sea , you can also go anywhere in the town , near from the shopping are , near the see , banks , people are friendly there , recommended if you want a place to sleep but its not a 5 stars hotel .
reviews.title: Good location , nice view , near everything

reviews.text: read all the reviews and you can get a good picture of what to expect from this hotel.  the room was clean, but very low quality.  old furniture.  door had been repaired and left with different colored wood all nailed together.  air conditioner barely blew out air, but the room was not hot.  the food from the restaurant was edible, but nothing special and even if you order the same thing, every time it will be different so that you don't know what to expect.  so this is the kind of hotel where you stay as a last resort, or because it may be cheap. (i can't speak about the price, because my employer paid.)  the service was very helpful.  there was an ok view of the sea from my window, and the location of the hotel is good.  also wifi only in the lobby.
reviews.title: low quality / basic

reviews.text: Felt like I'm in some cheap motel, rooms are very basic but clean. 2 stars only for location being surrounded with places to eat, also being in a crowded street it was very noisy if ure in a room that overlooks the street (room 104). Bathroom smells terrible and dont let me start about the breakfast! Awful awful food.. 100 day old food and the omelette was extremely oily. Was not enjoyable and I dont recommend.
reviews.title: Below average.. dont bother!

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 days, the hotel has a good location near to the sea and main attractions, good breakfast, small rooms with poor sound isolation. Overall it is nice only for a short stay if you are seeking a low budget accommodation. Nothing special !
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: I have spending 3 months till now, My friend has been electrically shocked in bathroom, my bathroom was out of electricity for two days, Bad housekeeping, bad service, old furniture and bad infrastructure. No respect of guests.
reviews.title: Dengours / Unsafe Place

reviews.text:
Rooms are poor, Insulation between rooms is terrible, room doors are sluggish, Internet isn't working, breakfast is late starts 8 am to 10 am, Room Rates are expensive.
Location is great surrounded by several restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Just Consider it a Rented Bed

reviews.text: Stayed only 1 night and was more than enough...  no service,dirty rooms,no WiFi,shower was aiming at the wall and fixed in this position,elevator really dirty and stopped halfway to exit door.... etc,etc
reviews.title: Never again..

reviews.text:
The hotel is in bad condition, need an urgent restyling.
The room was old and dirty, and was impossible close well the window; if you rent a room road side sleep is very difficult. Lobby boys don't speak English and invadent
reviews.title: Just one night, and is it enough...

reviews.text:
I stay at this hotel every year for a couple of days. The hotel is located in the main street of Port Said. The hotel rooms is clean but old furniture, breakfast is not that good, but The price is cheap compared to Port Said low services and quality of life.

Hope my review is useful.
reviews.title: Good hotel for B&B only

reviews.text: Decent clean rooms. If possible, book the upper floors for a good view of the Mediterranean Sea and the Suez Canal. The cooling system is not very easy to use. Cigarette smoke from the next room kind of found it's way into my WC. The meals full of variety.
reviews.title: Good place

location.address: 72 Al Gomhuria Street, Port Said 99999 Egypt

name: De La Poste Hotel
rankingString: #1 of 4 B&Bs / Inns in Port Said

reviews.text: My friend and I decided to have an week away from Luxor and went to Port Said.  We booked into the De La Poste Hotel, and it was the best thing we did.  The staff - amazing.  Location - amazing.  Hotel - amazing.  The hotel is old world, and I would love to have seen it in it's glory so many years ago.  We must also say that the beds were so comfortable, falling asleep was no problem.  A definite plus.   Due to floods in Cairo we were late in arriving and exhausted.  The staff couldn't have been more considerate.  We were taken straight up to our rooms and coffee was sent up to us.  No matter what we wanted, it wasn't a problem.  Stephanie who served our breakfast was so considerate, right down to going out for milk for our NescafÃ© (she doesn't realise we saw her do this).  Thanks also to Ebrahim,  Mohammed, Omar, and one or two of the staff whose names I didn't manage to get.  You were wonderful.  With millions of thanks to everyone.  You guys are absolute stars.  Dianne and Kate
reviews.title: Fabulous time in Port Said

reviews.text:
Only stayed here for one night. Its totally unjustified when you read some of the negative comments made.

This is an heritage building. Therefore it does come with certain drawbacks, but remember, you are staying in a hotel which was an intringle part of Port Said history.

Yes, the wooden floor does make a skewking sound but thats how an old floor is supposed to sound. Instead of complaining, appreciate the 25ft high ceiling. A very large newly painted room with an enclosed balcony. Where would you nowdays find a room with a fan and a very quiet AC. Clean bathroom.  A 24" TV. I was even surprised that the hotel had a lift.

All these for a mere $25 - $30 a night including breakfast. For this price, do not expect a full spread of a buffett breakfast.

Location is unbeatable. The cornich is just 3 minutes of walking. Surrounded by plenty of cafes and restaurants.

Check-in was fast and was allowed an early check-in. Wi-fi works on and off near the entrance but without internet browsing. Not sure what this is but this is the message I got on my phone.

For me, this hotel is Value for Money when compared to the absurd prices being charged by some of the so called resorts in Port Said.
reviews.title: Worth Every Penny

reviews.text:
We stayed here for two nights, only because it was the cheapest hotel we found in overpriced Port Said,  but it was more than double the cost of anywhere else we have stayed in Egypt. 
We negotiated a small discount, and because of that  the receptionist refused to give us the WiFi code. 
The hotel is in a lovely old colonial building but is run down with peeling paint and grubby walls. A poor breakfast is included in the room rate, served in a sad looking canteen with a few forlorn people sitting around smoking. 
On the plus side, you get clean sheets, two large towels, toilet paper and some soap. The TV works and thereâ€™s a light switch near the bed, something for your money at least!
Itâ€™s much cheaper to book in advance online if youâ€™re planning ahead, but donâ€™t expect a friendly welcome.
reviews.title: Overpriced, gloomy with surly staff.

reviews.text: New renovations happening to this place and I like it. Great prices and friendly staff. Perfect Location. Spacious rooms with high ceilings and wooden floors. I like the outdoor cafe and the place is comfortable and cozy. I highly recommend to any traveller.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This place is a real sh.... hole ! Coackroches, disgusting dirt everywhere (scarce and poor products provided to the cleaning staff), 40 years old sheets and pillows, poor matresses, dirty and gloomy common spaces. Extremely Noisy. Elevator makes a loud ring everytime it moves, night and day, people yelling in the middle of the night in the corridor. Extremely rude and impolite management. They only look for money without a bit of respect for their guests. Basically you are a walking wallet and you are not even thanked for it. An alcohol joint is in the hotel too.
reviews.title: One of the worst ever

reviews.text:
Very reasonable for the low price 
Is have a great location 
I loved the high ceiling design
And the room is really big for a hotel with a lovely balcony
I didn't really liked the bathroom very old
If you are tall you will not be happy with the bed
reviews.title: Very reasonable for the price

reviews.text:
The rooms are bigger than average, with nice wooden floors. Good showers too.
The staff is friendly, and they have wifi at the cafe.
They have a lift to get you to the upper floors. The hotel is 5mn from the jetty to take the free ferry taking you to Asia.
Walk 10mn on you left, and you will see on your right side 'Lord' the best sweet shop I have seen around.
reviews.title: Great rooms, good location

reviews.text:
Pros :

Great location
Great views
Clean rooms
Helpful enough staff
Free parking 

Cons :

No a single staff member wore a mask
Bar has limited selection of drinks
Breakfast has no meat options whether hot or cold
WiFi was kinda slow

Despite all the cons.. I will keep coming back cuz I love the views and I have a lot of memories here but the place is nowhere near how it was as a sonesta

Portsaid is a lovely small town for a one night chill especially in winter
reviews.title: Good for a one night stay

reviews.text: I visited the hotel on August 11th for 3 nights, on our last night after housekeeping cleaned the room I didnâ€™t find my AirPods Pro. First I didnâ€™t suspect anything and kept looking but didnâ€™t find it and called the reception, they said that housekeepers were already gone and theyâ€™ll ask them first thing in the morning. The next day (checkout day) they told me same person who cleaned the room called sick and didnâ€™t come today! The same moment another person was reporting that also his AirPods Pro was stolen! It seems like housekeepers are targeting specific items and no one from hotel management even cared. Wonâ€™t recommend at all
reviews.title: I got robbed!

reviews.text: We have stayed at Resta Hotel for 5 nights, We reserved two rooms, the level of the cleaning wasnâ€™t good at all! The floor was dusty and the closet was dirty like never been wiped! The room service only came once during the five nights! What a horrible service! The breakfast was ok! If you sat by the pool area you are not allowed to have food from outside! Which was disappointed for us! The food at their cafeteria is expensive and not tasty! The refrigerator in the room too small and barely working! When my kids swim at the pool, several times they didnâ€™t get a towel! Even if the asked!!Thereâ€™s a big difference between the old owner Sonesta and Resta! Very disappointing service for a great location hotel!!!
reviews.title: Very disappointing!

reviews.text: The hotel right next to the mouth of the Suez canal gives an excellent view of the canal and the sea from the room. I had stayed in the suite room and the room was excellently done up and spacious. The largest bathroom i had seen in any of the hotels I have stayed in Egypt. The food at the restaurant was very good and had an excellent helping. More that enough for a person. The bed was well done up and comfortable. Would definitely recommend the hotel for future stays.
reviews.title: Great Location! Comfortable stay!

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, the rooms are clean, the location is great looking over the canal. The breakfast was really great and there was a variety. Easy to reach the hotel and the prices are reasonable âœ…..
reviews.title: Warm stay

reviews.text:
Came to resta for day usÃ¨ for the first time. Have visited many times in the evenings and it feels like 2 different hotels.i have worked in hospitality and tourism for many years and the contrast between the day and evening staff is massive.
Im the evening the staff and service are exceptional along with amazing food which is of good quality and excellent price.
However
In the day its all different. The service is awful, none of the staff are friendly and smiling, no name badges worn, questioned about if we knew the price of a bottle of wine, not full information given regarding the daily charge (150 le) which is deducted from the food and drinks bill and the end. Asked 3 times for a menu then given printed menus of which both were different. Then having to wait over 20 mins and ignored for the 'none foreign'guests. Again to be ignored as the waiter just wandered off inside.
Finally got our order took by another unhappy staff member no smile no thank you no nothing!
The service needs massive improvement,staff need to smile and be welcoming to ALL nationalities. The recreation guy obviously has a fab job chilling tshirt less on his shift. Nice job.
Once again the service in the evening is excellent as is the welcome.
But please please please sort the front of house staff during the day as really from the gentleman in the resturant we paid our money too the recreation man and one of the waiters at the pool their guest service is awful.
BIG BIG thanks to the chef whos food is excellent, spring rolls club sandwich beef fillet etc are all excellent freshly prepared and presented to a high standard.
Happy staff equals happy guests.
reviews.title: Day Use

reviews.text:
First visit to Port Said with very bad experience at hotel
High value for the room 
Very bad view , very noisy room as Central A/C machine under room 
All rooms view with the same rate price which is not fair 1100 LE and canâ€™t change room 

I will not come here again
reviews.title: Very Bad hotel experience

reviews.text:
I would like to express my thanks to all the staff at Resta hotel for a very friendly stay. I stayed just over 2 weeks and would have no problems staying another.

On arrival I was welcomed with a free upgrade and the reception staff couldn't be friendlier.

Food was fantastic and the General Manager happily added items to breakfast buffet when asked.

Habibi Resta ;-)
reviews.title: Port Said Visit

reviews.text: Very nice hotel as some rooms has a great view for the entrance of Suez Canal but the hotel needs some maintenance in some rooms and service needs improvement but overall it is nice hotel and the renovated rooms are really nice
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a nice view

location.address: Sultan Hussein Street, Port Said 1111 Egypt

name: New Continental Hotel
rankingString: #6 of 9 Specialty lodging in Port Said

reviews.text:
Hotel seems to be located close to port which convenient to location. It was noted that internally hotel forgot when last time was cleaned (garbage and cigarette bids on the stairs and floor). The noise insulation next to zero as being in room noise from the street could be heard the same as being on the balcony. 
There is a restaurant within hotel building, however, it seems to be working during the breakfast hours only. The breakfast being served by the person who seems to be did ot change his clothing for several days. No drinking water was available at the hotel. I have requested meal for dinner and it was delivered from the street restaurant.
reviews.title: Not the best experience

location.address: 30 El Gomhoureya St. Intersection Of Babel St. El Shark District, Port Said Egypt

reviews.text: Was accommodated here whilst in Port Said on business the room offered 104 was right above the street where a constant flow of traffic with poorly trained drivers streamed past beeping their vehicle horns. Complained was relocated 1 floor up to room 206 with little improvement therefore checked out and sought accommodation elsewhere.
reviews.title: Basic Accommodation

reviews.text:
The price comparing to the service was good
The room has the basics bed, Small LCD, toilet, and phone
The quality of the furniture os not the best as well as there is no functioning internet connection in the room. The hotel has nice restaurant at its seventh floor yet we preferred to each outside as they donâ€™t have variety of food to select
The hotel is located at the middle of el Gomhoria St the nice place to make shopping. It is located few steps to the ferry  that transfer people between both suez canal banks ( for free)
reviews.title: Fair price in the city

reviews.text: we went for two days it was amazing the hotel in the center of the city clean room the stuff so kind the breakfast was good the elevetor is old .the parking is so small but you dont need to drive because every thing near to the hotel
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: It is located in a busy area with a lot of shops around. Initial impression of the hotel is very poor and looks like an old hotel. Single Elevator and looks like an antique one and goes with a noise. No proper bellboys to assist you but everyone is asking for tips. AC in the room is a window AC which was very noisy and not cooling properly. Bathroom was a basic bathroom with hardly any facilities. Restaurant is on the top floor with very minimum choice of food and neither the Breakfast, Lunch and dinner was good. cold and nobody cares for their customers. Everyone around is always asking for tips and can be irritating for any traveller. Wifi is available but is being charged. overall a pathetic hotel which i had to stay prior joining the ship.
reviews.title: Poor Quality Hotel

reviews.text: it is loacted in good place surrounding by many shops.Food limited choice, wifi but $5/ day charge.Everyone asking for tips and not much friendly  staff.Even cleaning staff despiratly wants to clean the room even if you dont want as after that they ask tips.

reviews.text: The hotel is poor and old but it is in a very good area in the middle of the city near all services and close to the canal. The food is not good and the service is also not good. Elevators are old. Television has few channels and no free Internet in the rooms.

Also the lady who cleans the rooms is so nice. Food simple but enough.

location.address: Port Said 495 Egypt

name: Port Said Hotel & Apartments
hotelClassAttribution: This property is classified according to Giata.
rankingString: #4 of 9 Specialty lodging in Port Said

reviews.text:
Booked a 2-bedroom suite for an urgent 4-day business trip.
The price announced on booking.com was not inclusive of a lot of taxes, and I ended up paying 31% over the advertised figure. Anyway...
A big drawback is the lack of breakfast, but each room has a small fridge and a kettle and cups. We also got a tray with sachets of tea, herbals, instant coffee, and sugar. There are 2 large spaces on the ground level, seemingly conference rooms; one of them could be used as a restaurant for breakfast.
At this price one expects free WiFi, but none is installed.
All the rooms are on the 1st floor and upwards, but no elevator. This was a serious problem with an elderly guest accompanying me.
Rooms are nicely furnished, nothing trendy or fancy. Aircon, LCD TV, large closet, extra blankets, etc.
Bathroom is quite small with a shower cabin. Average amenities, hair dryer. A peculiar item is a shaving kit, but not so surprising considering it is mainly an Armed Forces guest house.
Cleanliness is excellent except in the corridors and stairs. There are spots of spilled liquid on all steps, and black marks on the walls despite a placard asking not to lean with hands on the walls...
The view from the front rooms is superb, but street noise and guests noise and staff noise is continuous day and night. The back rooms are quieter but face a dingy street.
Staff is polite and efficient. Check-in and -out is reasonably simple and fast.
Good place for a family with children on vacations, but not recommended for business travellers.
reviews.title: So-So

Very bad vacation and will not repeated
reviews.title: Very bad experience

reviews.text:
I stayed only 1 night for business. Entering the lobby, it feels like a palace. Entering the room, it is very average.... In agreement with another reviewer, the reception staff (3 yound ladies) are never smiling, speak harshly, and are not helpful. The most often heard sentence in the mouths of these ladies is "Please wait". It took almost 30 minute to get a formal invoice done because at 0915H the cashier was not there... and could not stamp it because at 0945H the manager was not there either. 
Obviously the owner(s) are not interested about customer satisfaction, only about fancy decoration of this lobby.
My room was reasonably clean despite weathered tasteless furniture, paint, and wall tiles, which is sort of forgiven for a shorefront hotel. Strangely, the bathroom was disproportionate : they could have moved a wall 1m to give more space in the room and less in the bathroom. Wifi signal was weak but manageable. The room had a small fridge, kettle, 2 cups, A/C, and local and satellite TV, all OK. Nice balcony overlooking a garden, and the sea at an angle. I believe there are other rooms with a full sea view.
In conclusion, kick the management out, pull out decoration, throw away furniture, and bring in a professional operator, and you will have a very good hotel.
reviews.title: Facade

reviews.text: Although the hotel's got the best location in the city but it needs major maintenance in all the public areas and land scaping, stuff are totally unprofessional especially the ladies at the receptions who are not friendly at all. There was no backup generator or any power source when they had power shut down.
reviews.title: Poor service & unprofessional staff
